name: About
description: The Forked River Amateur Radio Club is a group of individuals dedicated to furthering the hobby of amateur radio and providing emergency disaster communications using our skillset.Membership Club membership is open to any individual residing in or near the Lacey Township, NJ area with an interest in amateur radio. Club members need not be licensed amateur radio operators, however most club activities will be best enjoyed by those with a license.
body: The Forked River Amateur Radio Club is a group of individuals dedicated to furthering the hobby of amateur radio and providing emergency disaster communications using our skillset.Membership Club membership is open to any individual residing in or near the Lacey Township, NJ area with an interest in amateur radio. Club members need not be licensed amateur radio operators, however most club activities will be best enjoyed by those with a license.Club Officers Jim Bangert - President   About Jim Bangert  Jim Bangert is the founder of Wildfire Enterprises and a licensed amateur radio operator, holding the callsign KB2UNK.  Gavin Rozzi - Vice President   About Gavin Rozzi  A college student at Stockton University and political journalist. Gavin has been licensed as amateur radio station KD2CXZ since 2012

name: Club Frequencies
description: The Forked River Amateur Radio Club makes use of several frequencies to communicate over amateur radio. Please program your radios with the frequencies listed in this table if you wish to communicate with our members and participate in club activities. The Club may also utilize other public repeaters or traditional calling frequencies at our discretion.We are currently making use of simplex frequencies for radio contact within the Lacey area. Our members are in the process of migrating to DMR digital radios to supplement analog communications.
body: The Forked River Amateur Radio Club makes use of several frequencies to communicate over amateur radio. Please program your radios with the frequencies listed in this table if you wish to communicate with our members and participate in club activities. The Club may also utilize other public repeaters or traditional calling frequencies at our discretion.We are currently making use of simplex frequencies for radio contact within the Lacey area. Our members are in the process of migrating to DMR digital radios to supplement analog communications. Members have been active on local DMR systems that cover the Ocean County area as well as traditional analog systems.Table of Frequencies: Frequency (MHz)Channel NameCTCSS / DCSBand   146.500 FR Simplex 1 CSQ 2m   446.500 FR Simplex 2 (DMR) TS 1, CC1, TG 99 70cm
